meanings.definition: To become liquid or soft as a result of warming.
meanings.sent1: The ice will thaw in the sun.
meanings.sent2: I thawed the frozen meat in the microwave.
meanings.sent3: The snowman began to thaw and slowly melted away.
meanings.sent4: Her heart started to thaw as she listened to his apology.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the fire caused the frozen lake to thaw rapidly.

meanings.definition: To become less reserved or aloof.
meanings.sent1: After a while, she began to thaw and opened up to her new friends.
meanings.sent2: He thawed from his initial standoffishness and joined the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy old man surprisingly started to thaw and shared a joke.
meanings.sent4: His stern expression thawed into a smile when he saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The ice queen finally began to thaw and show her true emotions.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming liquid or soft as a result of warming.
meanings.sent1: The thaw of the frozen river signaled the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent2: We could hear the gentle crackling of the thaw in the winter morning.
meanings.sent3: The sudden thaw caught everyone off guard, causing some flooding.
meanings.sent4: The slow thaw of the ice created a beautiful pattern on the lake's surface.
meanings.sent5: The thaw brought a sense of relief as the harsh winter finally ended.
